sub_title: Research Master Student at Tinbergen Institute
summary: I am interested in macroeconomics and urban economics. Specifically, I am interested in the roles of governments in shaping markets in order to protect economic human rights, along with how second-best economic reasoning can be used to advocate for socio-economic policies. My current research interest is the interaction between monetary economics, the banking industry, and the construction sector.

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Sciences

organizations.name: Youth Unity Model United Nations
organizations.position: Co-Founder; Deputy-Secretary-General (2018); Head of Content Department (2018, 2020)

projects.title: Alternative Educations Summer School
projects.description:
In this project, I work with my team members to organize a summer school at my local hometown of Vinh City, Nghe An. In this summer school, we aim to educate young people about current global problems such as but not limited to racism, Covid-19, and Mental Wellbeing.

I was the Curriculum Designer and the Lecturer of 4 out of 5 classes at this summer school: (1) Racism, (2) Economics and Covid-19, (3) Academic Writing, and (4) Coaching.

[*] I was one of the two lecturers and curriculum designers of the Coaching class.

contributors.headline: Research Master Student at Tinbergen Institute

projects.title: Advanced Placement Capstone Research Project
projects.description: Abstract: "There is a problem with identifying factors in young adult dystopian novels that attract young adult readers. Indeed, there has been some research papers performing content analysis on books that their researchers found successful to identify common characteristics in factors such as themes, writing styles, and characters. But there has been no research viewing such factors from the perspectives of the audience. A research project includes surveying the readers’ opinions regarding the importance of each factor in successful young adult dystopian books (the reader-response methodology) can fill in this knowledge gap. With that research, data has been collected and by analyzing it, it is concluded that young adult dystopian literature is more appealing to teenagers that share the same psychologically developmental experiences with the protagonist within such literature."

contributors.headline: Research Master Student at Tinbergen Institute

projects.title: Creative Writing and Democracy Education
projects.description:
To graduate from my high school of THINK Global School, I need to carry out a long-term project called my "Mastery Project." In this project, I try to explore my fondness for creative writing and politics. 

Using the dystopian style, I want to learn and write about how nationalism-like ideologies can lead to the end of democracy. Throughout this project, I will not only learn about politics but also skills of a professional creative writer such as world-building, plot and character development, and editing techniques.

contributors.headline: Research Master Student at Tinbergen Institute

projects.title: Digital LGBT Education Workshop
projects.description:
During the corona pandemic of 2020, I have held an online workshop to educate youngsters in my hometown about the LGBT community in order to encourage sympathy towards this minority community through education and understanding. This workshop, in the curriculum of my high school of THINK Global School, is known as my "Service Learning Project" - a graduation requirement.

The workshop is divided into three different one-hour sessions. The first session tries to educate people about the four factors to define a person's gender and sexuality: biological sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and gender expression. It also tries to break the Vietnamese prejudice that people of the LGBT community people cannot succeed by showing examples of successful queer people. The second session discusses how toxic masculinity in the Vietnamese context leads to homophobia. The final session educates participants about the current Vietnamese law on same-sex marriage and their cons.

contributors.headline: Research Master Student at Tinbergen Institute

projects.title: Model Policy Designing: Legalization of Sex Work In India
projects.description: In my second semester of THINK Global School in which I get to visit Calcutta, India, I investigate the possibility of legalizing sex work in India. Being able to be on the field, I was able to interview sex workers in the region and talk to organizations protecting sex workers in the region and those that are trafficked. Combining this with academic researches and documents, I formulate a policy proposal paper discussing how legalization of sex workers can actually protect sex workers in the region and prevent the trafficking of sex workers from nearby region such as but not limited to Bangladesh.
